comments.commentBody: Governor Perry purposely dodged debating or even acknowledging his Democratic challenger in the 2010 election, and the Texas news media totally gave him a pass. But this will not be the case for his fight for the GOP nomination -- he will have no choice but to debate his fellow Republicans for the nomination. If he cannot stand the heat with his fellow Republicans, yet is still given the nomination (which I now have doubts will happen by Republican primary voters), then he will be aced by Obama in the Presidential debates. He will not be allowed to dodge his fellow Republicans and the President.

First, the Giants cannot be accused of parsimony simply because they're required to spend almost to the level of the salary cap. No team in the NFL can any longer be accused of that.

At the same time, it does appear our GM is developing quite a reputation for being less than friendly when seeing players off. He also appears to backtrack from his word when making promises. While everyone does this to one extent or another, that he's developed this reputation is the concern.

As for what Cofield said, it has also been rumored the Giants didn't treat Boss well on the way out either. I'm certainly not going to dismiss it immediately simply because I love the Giants. There's no rule that says my favorite team can't make mistakes.

good job! he will shout it to the corners of this country. one thing for sure the pubs are in an interesting spot and they even have a member of the deficit committe ready to quit if anyone suggest a cut to defense? now there's a guy who dosen't believe in compromise?
but i support the president because he is on the right road and i will vote for him and hope for a dem majority in both houses so we can get this country back on the road to prosperity for all

It is first time I saw where speaker of congress only stood up twice in all of 40 minutes of the speech of president. Most all past times it is about 4 to 7 times when speaker stands up. When will republican be gracious enough to be civil. I think it should be ruled criminal by voters who selected him as congress man. Wake up Ohio and make sure that this speaker, one of 12 kids who has made sure that his each sibling is more than a millionaire never sees the congress again and not elect him.

Whether he were to offer the perfect plan, that would still not suffice because the Fascists sitting in the gallery and on the other side of the aisle will do everything in their power to block whatever Obama offers.

No matter how you slice this now, the United States is on a downhill trend and nothing can stop that because there is no longer a United in the United States.

Read the comments, because that becomes clear with any one of fifteen that are proffered.

You are falling and nothing is going to stop that fall.

Meanwhile, the NE is floating away and several more storms in the making and on the way will finalise that float.

I wonder whether the Potomac can raise enough to float the Washington Monument out to sea.
Finally I have a logical explanation to my ex's behavioral issues.

"U.S. officials said Thursday evening they have "specific, credible but unconfirmed" information about a potential threat against the United States coinciding with the 10th anniversary of the September 11 terrorist attacks." If I were a Terrorist I would consider this weeks Jets/Dallas game to be the perfect target.

It is on 9-11. It is on national TV. There will be a ceremony to commemorate the lost lives. There will be a Mob of people so no one will will receive much attention. Finally there are the difficulties posed by the tailgating parties. People prepare food, therefore there are many tanks of propane gas and a lot of unchecked boxes of food and coolers of beer. At the very least be on guard if you attend the game. I believe the City of N.Y. or the Jets should decide to restrict tailgating parties at this game. An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.

It must be tempting for Obama to do things like reduce the payroll tax but I agree with a commenter that it likely will have minimal impact. He really seems to believe that spending more and more is the answer. And the $14 trillion deficit which recently caused a credit downgrade (deserved in my view)just doesn't seem to get much press lately.

The Iraq and Afghanistan wars are projected to cost $4 trillion, and my sense is that in the end, it will be far more. Why is talk of significant defense and military cuts somehow always back burned? As one commentator noted, we still have 50,000 troops in Germany! And a large number in Korea and other installations scattered around the world.

We can no longer afford to 'police' the world, and many countries wish we would get out. Basic math : endless payouts do not decrease the deficit, they increase it. Maybe Obama should take an Econ 101 class as clearly he understands little about money and spending.

It was a good speech, and all the gripping about SS is counterproductive. Current projections show there is at least another 20 years before the trust is bankrupt and this can be remedied by raising the limit on the payroll tax so that the rich will be paying more into the fund. When it comes to SS i would be more worried about the fact that it is one of the largest holders of US bonds and the charade that was the debt celeing debate earlier this year was more dangerous than the cut obama proposed.

It was good to see obama come out fighting, like many of you i have been greatly dissapointed by his failure to confront the GOP. The part of the speech i most appreciated was the final part where he rebuked the standard tea party line that all government is evil, we need more of that, someone to remind us that government built the infrastructure, educates your kids, puts out fires, keeps the water clean and polices the streets.

How many jobs the plan creates depends on whether it can get through congress and how much of it get through. In any case it puts republicans in a box either saying no to a jobs plan in favor of helping bug business or saying yes to plan that goes against their rhetoric. For those of you still dissapointed with obama after the speech i can assure if it were a republican president all you would see is tax cuts, tax breaks and spending cuts which would make things worse for a moajority of people

Assuring a lawmaker that his speech on jobs wouldn't interfere with an NFL game?  Someone rejected his making the speech a day earlier because of a political debate?  Who are these people?  The President was talking about the biggest problem we face and it's all games and posturing.  I'm an Independent, and they've lost my vote.

I've kind of lost track of Juve's various peregrinations, but one recent home (the last one?) was tiny, something like 27k. That's more appropriate to a Cesena or Atalanta, not the Old Lady of Serie A. A brand new stadium seating 40k does seem quite small for a club of Juve's stature, and I also wonder how it will fare in the world of FFP. How will it compete with the Camp Nous and OTs, or even the San Siros? But then ISTR seeing trendlines of Serie A attendance -- and it doesn't look good. Juventus in particular took a huge hit of course from Calciopoli, but other big clubs also either took a hit or more or less stayed flat, even Inter, who were not implicated (at the time, anyway). Even so, that a new stadium comparable in size to Anfield or White Hart Lane (whose tenants are finding them cramped) is what Juventus is moving into is ... strange.

Nice bit of trivia re: Notts County. I didn't know that!

To those who want to follow Perry's ponzi schem on Social Security, here are a few facts.

Social Security does not add to the federal deficit. Right now it has a 2.7 billion dollar surplus. It can pay all promised benefits for the next 25 years. Politicians want to use this money and fill it with tax receipts. Well, they no longer want to pay it back, so Obama will just "transform" it.

Barack Obama is depleting the fund by his gift to employers, (like they need it), a Social Security tax holiday. He does this to make sure the fund is depleted quickly so it can 'transformed' as his greatest gift to Americans as he waves goodbye from office.

Who is running a ponzi scheme?

Just like the stimulus package, the President’s plan will not work. Why? Too much "central planning" with no input from the average person.

We can incentivize submission to the President of the necessary workforce intelligence for accurate Federal resource provisioning through a formal market. I propose that we devise an international labor commodity futures exchange. If we can use futures for auguring movie ticket sales, i.e., Cantor Exchange, and for global terrorism--FutureMAP, we can use futures for expert global human resource fulfillment.

It is so sad that our country has never truly trusted capitalism to solve its problems.

How can the Federal Government know more about how to solve problems than the citizens and employers who are directly affected? Incentivize _everyone_ to participate according to his expertise through financial products that have been strategically engineered to solicit his opinion.

I am engineering an electronic trading platform right now.

Larry Leathers, Macroeconomist, Naehe
larry@naehe.com

Had the Wells Fargo approved a loan to me, by now I would have given employment to people, have made beautiful living place to many or helped residents living better. Why our banks are not extending credits to diligent people in a secured business?

To all Congress members: For the good of the country, please be united, and focus of the US citizens' well being.  Suggestion: all members of congress not to receive a paycheck until job creation bill is implemented. I'm sure you will agree that bill will be passed quickly in so doing.

Best wishes to America in hopes that the Dems and Repubs work together to do what Washington can do to get us out of this economic hole. What can I do? What can you do to get our economy rolling again. Enough blame throwing. Now is the time to work together and make progress for all. And we will pay back the costs including Social Security payments with other budget reductions. Now is the time to quit "carping" and join the solution.
If they are ending Social Security, then I want all the money I ever paid into it back in one tax-free lump sum asap, thank you.
With regard to this nations priorities I'm glad I know where the unemployed stand.  The GOP is first and pro-football is second.  Does that make the unemployed third?  Who's on third?

As an independent voter, I vote based on my politics, not my party and am open to candidates of either party that makes sense. I already see that the Republicans with whom I most agree will not be on the ballot and therefore a Republican will not have my vote. Disappointed in Obama? Yes, but you people kill me; so willing to cut off your nose to spite your face that you are willing to vote for a Republican, any Republican to prove a point to whom exactly? You won't be satisfied until there is no Medicare, Social Security, Medicaid, unemployment, no free public schools, no student loans etc. and I hate to tell you but these programs are a few of the safety nets that keep America from being like any other third world country. If most Americans are honest with themselves, they will admit that whether they have a "good job" or not, the only reason they are able to have much of anything is because of credit; student loans, mortgages, car loans... Who cares how much your fancy home in your gated community is worth if no one can qualify for a loan to buy it from you? And if the Republicans have their way, the rest of us can eat cake while they and their friends laugh all the way to the bank. So if you think you will be hurting Obama (who believe me will be doing just fine whether he wins or looses the election), go on ahead, I DARE YOU, vote for a Republican and laugh now, but cry later.

OUR President was forceful tonight, and he spoke up for many of those people who have been forgotten by the GOP and their Tea Party nonsense.
Let's fix up some roads and bridges, hire more teachers and police officers, get some folks who've been out of work for more than six months back to work, and extend unemployment.
If we have to cut the defense budget some and tighten up some rules and regulations on SS and Medicare -- maybe means testing or not supporting useless expensive treatments at end of life -- then so be it.
And if we tax Warren Buffett and GE more -- woo hoo! Justice is served. The top 1% of the wealth pyramid will only own 20% of everything instead of 25% of everything.
Think about the choices we have ahead of us.
We have President Obama, who gave a heck of a speech tonight, with his heart clearly in the right place, on one hand.
On the other hand, we have Romney and Huntsman, who aren't not completely nuts, along with Electric Chair Rick Perry and his Ponzi scheme nonsense.
Who do you think would do better by America?

I don't think Obama will win this war of rhetoric. I think the Republican spin machine will simply respond that this country hasn't been able to spend its way out of a bad economy with previous stimulus packages. The Republicans will simply characterize this as more irresponsible spending, and point to the S&P downgrade as evidence that Obama's plan will doom this country.

You might think that's nonsense or God's honest truth. But simply in terms of rhetorical points, if the Republicans go with that kind of spin it will carry much more weight with Middle American than Obama's speech will. A lot can happen between now and November 2012, but right I am bracing myself for a Republican president in 2013.
It was a good speech, but the plan seems too small to do much good -- it's a little over half the size of the previous stimulus and that provided only modest growth.

First the President calls a rare joint session of Congress, citing the urgent need to address unemployment. Admittedly, he's 32 months late, but no one can argue that the need is great.

Then he plays political games with the scheduling of it.

And tonight he delivers a campaign speech.

I have so given up on him.

#302 SS is not a tax, but a contribution to the SS trust fund--in reality a savings account that can only be opened on retirement. It also includes a 6.5 % contribution from your employer and you can look at that as a hidden weekly raise. That's 13% every payday toward your future solvency.
Anyone who votes for the "payroll tax deduction" is only hurting their own future.

I thought the speech effective for it's fallacious content. If you ever had a doubt that Obama is after Social security and Medicare, doubt no longer.

The dishonestly in his remarks were clearly about the payroll tax vacation. I am betting this will be made permanent. It deletes the fund faster and will
give more ammunition for continued raping of the receipts. Since this is Obama's baby, or I should say babies, Social Security and Medicare dismantlement, then you just heard the first burp.

Another offensive part was that the unemployed work free in exchange for tax cuts to the employer. Okayyy. Great way to make sure that wages will be stagnant. I know people really want to work and they need too work. However,he's using the desperation of the unemployed to set a bench mark for lower wages.

Last, if you are a Democrat and you have heard any Obama speeches, you know that he never means what he says. This speech was about reelection not about people. Rick Perry thinks Social Security is a ponzi scheme. Obama offers another sneakier way to say that he believes it is also.
